im not even a streamer
Even still, when not drawing, if he wasn't introverted, he would speak before and after he was done drawing. Of course people won't talk much if they are concentrating on something.
Yeah, that called a mic monitor, it's supposed to do that.
to a degree
yeah only when enabled
it does not do that by default
my mic does it whenever the mic is on
that's something you have to enable and disable
Depends on the headset.
you have to set that, nottrace, that's not normal, nor is it default
Yes I know most mics have the option to disable it. as I said. mine is a POS
you will not find a headset designed to make the user listen to what it records
obviously a PC headset with a config menu will have those options, but i've had plenty of headsets where it was on by default and there was no way to shut that off.
they don't have it on by default XD
turtle beach p11. it does. search it
yeah i dont have config options
I own a turtle beach headset, and mine doesn't. That's your own stuff doin it
not the headset
My Turtle Beach X51s do that too
if i plug my headset into a battery bank for a phone it does it if i turn on the mic
it's probably what you have it connected to doing it, the headset will not do that by default.
def does it by defult
then you don't know how mics work, mate
It does it regardless of what I have it plugged into. I've had adapter cables since it was made for the Xbox 360, and no matter what I use it on, it still has the mic monitor always on.
it has a inline dac thing. it can do it.
being able to and doing it automatically are two different things
ok then it does it automatically when the mic is switched on
You say that, but that's not how mics work. Your headset doing that means whatever it's plugged into has the setting for listening to the mic enabled
wait my bad, mine are Turtle Beach X42s I misremembered.
a battery bank I got at best buy for $10 has a mic input over usb?
I doubt it
you can doubt it, but that's how it is. Headsets are not going to automatically push the mic signal to the headphones. they're two separate audio connections
tis why there's a earphones connection and a mic connection
nope
one's input, one's output
you can't tell me nope, that's how it works, mate
plug your mic into the speakers port in your pc and see how much it doesn't play audio
it's two different connections
I currently only have a usb plugged into my cpu for headphones. its handling power, mic, pc audio
its one connection
dac converts it
yeah one connection from the headset to the computer, but on the inside, it's not going to connect the two together.
yeah actually it does
no, actually, it does not
Just because it's over the same wire doesn't mean the signals are fused
you think HDMI fuses the video and audio together? No. They work completely separately
one can function while the other does not
Also the P11 and the X42 are both console headsets, consoles that don't have support for mic-monitoring.
but because they're over the same wire, when the wire dies, both die
so they monitoring is built into the internal DAC
My headset is an EarForce x1. It's an Xbox 360 headset.
If it were built in, you'd be able to turn it off.
Noone would buy a headset just so they can hear themselves.
not for a console
Mine does it where there is no lag.
I am sure some wonky ones may lag.

how im using it

because it being a pos is why you CANNOT TURN OFF THE MONITORING
